articleTitleTranslated: Suljovic / Rodriguez in the World Cup quarter-finals
articleContentTranslated: Suljovic ensured the important first win against de Sousa in the duel between the two number one players. â€œThe Gentleâ€ got off to an excellent start and made it 2-0.
In the hotly contested third leg, Suljovic pulled out of the affair with a goal to double one. Sousa, who was in top form recently, reported back with a break and reduced it to 2: 3.

But the Viennese kept his nerve and used his second match dart on the double-20 to win 4-2 when de Sousa was thrown. Suljovic managed to win against de Sousa for the first time, but was still upset after the duel.
The Portuguese was of the opinion that the Viennese would only have won because he would hardly have hit double fields himself. Suljovic did not agree with this statement.

â€œI don't know what he wants. I played brilliantly, â€said the 48-year-old in the winner's interview. MENSAGE WINS! Austria lead 1-0 in this Last 16 tie as World Cup ever-present Mensur Suljovic defeats Jose De Sousa 4-2!

Next up ğŸ‘‰ Rowby-John Rodriguez v Jose Marques pic.twitter.com/57hnJ6A3f3â€” PDC Darts (@OfficialPDC) November 7th, 2020 For the fifth time in the quarterfinals In the second duel Rodriguez met the World Cup debutant and blatant underdog Marques.
The 26-year-old Viennese gave a mixed performance, but showed his best darts in the crucial moments. With a 78 finish â€œLittle Johnâ€ made the first break of the game.
Marques could not add any more and gave up his accusation again. Rodriguez used his third match dart on the double seven to a sovereign 4-1 success.
The two Austrians saved themselves an all-important double and made it into the quarter-finals for the fifth time at the Team World Cup, which has been held since 2010.
The leap into the semifinals at the event endowed with 350,000 pounds (389,000 euros) has never been successful. â€œMensur's victory gave me strength and confidence.

Unfortunately, I didn't play that well, â€said Rodriguez, hoping for an improvement on Sunday. AUSTRIA WIN! ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¹ It's a clean sweep for host nation Austria as Rowby-John Rodriguez confidently despatches Jose Marques 4-1 for a 2-0 Austria victory!
